alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 4:00PM MST until July 31 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...A large area of heavy rain stretching from Happy Jack to Munds Park will cause some flooding into this evening. Expect minor flooding and some ponding of water on area roadways, washes, creeks and streams. * WHERE...Portions of north central and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pumphouse Wash, Sawmill Wash, West Fork Oak Creek, Brady Canyon, Grapevine Canyon, Rarick Canyon, Oak Creek, West Clear Creek, Yaeger Canyon, Anderson Canyon, Babbit Spring, Dry Beaver Creek, Howard Draw, Walnut Creek, Schoolhouse Draw, Rattlesnake Canyon and Jacks Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dairy Springs Campground, Mormon Lake, Munds Park, Stoneman Lake, Slide Rock State Park, Garland`s Oak Creek Lodge, Junipine Resort, Double Springs Campground, Manzanita Campground, Cave Springs Campground, Pine Flat Campground, Sterling Fish Hatchery and West Fork Of Oak Creek. - This includes the following swimming holes... Pumphouse Wash, Slide Rock and Encinoso. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 314 and 332. State Route 89A between mile markers 378 and 393. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
